SENT.plain: Five elderly hypertensive patients presented with grand mal seizures and had computed tomographic (CT) findings consistent with lacunar infarction
Three of them had also a recent hemiparesis, contralateral to the side of the CT findings
Follow-up CT scans supported the diagnosis of lacunar infarction
Contrary to the accepted opinion, generalized epileptic seizures may be the presenting symptom of lacunar brain infarction
